channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: クリエイター・エコノミーは、作家やアーティストにパーソナル・ブランドを構築し、インフルエンサーになることを強要し、多くのアーティストを不快にさせ、売り物のように感じさせている（Rebecca Jennings/Vox）
item.description:
Rebecca Jennings / Vox:
How the creator economy is forcing writers and artists to build personal brands and become influencers, making many artists uncomfortable and feel like sellouts  —  When Rachael Kay Albers was shopping around her book proposal, the editors at a Big Five publishing house loved the idea.

item.title: TechCrunchの広告収入とイベント収入を補完するために立ち上げられたTechCrunch+と、ビジネス記者の発掘問題による失敗について、TechCrunch+の創設編集者（Danny Crichton/Securities）。
item.description:
Danny Crichton / Securities:
TechCrunch+'s founding editor about its launch to complement TechCrunch's ads and events revenue and its failure due to issues with finding business reporters  —  January was a brutal month for journalists, globally from death and locally from layoffs.  The latter hit home this week …

item.title: ギニアにおけるメディア状況の悪化：政府はメディアを遮断・停止し、ジャーナリストを逮捕している（ジャーナリスト保護委員会）
item.description:
Committee to Protect Journalists:
A look at the deteriorating situation for media in Guinea, where the government has been blocking or suspending outlets and arresting journalists  —  Guinean authorities should immediately reverse the suspension of Dépêche Guinée and the privately owned news website's publishing director …

item.title: CBSニュースは、バイデン大統領がCBSのスーパーボウル試合前インタビューに応じないことを確認。
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
CBS News confirms that President Biden will not do a pre-game Super Bowl interview with CBS, the second year in a row that he has turned down the opportunity  —  An interview with the U.S. President in the hours before the Super Bowl has become a tradition in recent decades.

item.title: アゼルバイジャンは臨時選挙に向けた独立メディアの取り締まりを非難されている。アブザス・メディアを含む13人のジャーナリストが拘束された（David Pegg/The Guardian）。
item.description:
David Pegg / The Guardian:
Azerbaijan is accused of cracking down on independent media in the run-up to snap elections; 13 journalists, including from Abzas Media, have been detained  —  Sevinc Vaqifgizi is one of 13 independent journalists detained since snap presidential vote announced

item.title: Apple Vision Pro、このデバイスがスタジオの制作パイプラインをどのように変えるのか、デバイスの将来計画などについて、ディズニーの幹部にインタビュー（Harry McCracken/Fast Company）
item.description:
Harry McCracken / Fast Company:
Interviews with Disney executives about Apple Vision Pro, how the device is changing the studio's production pipelines, future plans for the device, and more  —  Years in the works, the new Disney+ app has an immersive new twist.  But the company sees it as one small step into a new entertainment medium with rich possibilities.

item.title: HBOは、ウクライナが戦争以来ロシアを支持していると非難した後、「The White Lotus」のキャストからミロ&スカロン;ビコビをカットした。
item.description:
Selome Hailu / Variety:
HBO cuts Miloš Biković from The White Lotus cast, after Ukraine accused him of supporting Russia since its war; Biković calls the move a “disturbing precedent”  —  HBO has cut Miloš Biković from the cast of “The White Lotus” Season 3 following a callout …

item.title: 自殺幇助を求めた女性を取材中、ボストン・グローブ紙のコラムニストが自殺幇助の書類に署名し、ジャーナリズムの倫理に疑問を呈した（Tom Jones/Poynter）
item.description:
Tom Jones / Poynter:
While reporting on a woman who sought assisted suicide, a Boston Globe columnist signed a form helping her to proceed, raising questions about journalism ethics  —  While reporting on a woman who sought assisted suicide, Kevin Cullen got personally involved, putting the Globe in an ethical dilemma.

item.title: EFF、Techdirt、MuckRock、DDoSecretsは、アピンの雇われハッカー疑惑の過去に関する報道を検閲することを目的とした法的脅威に、どのように反撃しているか（Andy Greenberg/Wired）
item.description:
Andy Greenberg / Wired:
How the EFF, Techdirt, MuckRock, and DDoSecrets are pushing back against legal threats aimed at censoring their reports on Appin's alleged hacker-for-hire past  —  A loose coalition of anti-censorship voices is working to highlight reports of one Indian company's hacker-for-hire past …

item.title: ダイヤモンド・スポーツがクリーブランド・ガーディアンズ、ミネソタ・ツインズ、テキサス・レンジャーズの試合を来季まで放送し続ける契約を締結（Jonathan Randles/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Jonathan Randles / Bloomberg:
Diamond Sports strikes a deal to continue broadcasting Cleveland Guardians, Minnesota Twins, and Texas Rangers games through the upcoming MLB season  —  - Broadcaster's deals with three MLB clubs runs through 2024  — Diamond said agreements averts potential fan disruption

item.title: 中国を拠点とする広告主は現在、メタ社の年間売上高の10％を占め、世界全体の売上高の伸びに5ポイント寄与している（フィナンシャル・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
Financial Times:
China-based advertisers now account for 10% of Meta's annual revenue and contributed 5 percentage points to its total worldwide revenue growth  —  The US group has benefited from huge but unsustainable outlays from Chinese advertisers  —  Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp may be banned in China.

item.title: Charterは、2022年第4四半期に14万5,000人のビデオ顧客を失ったが、9月のDisneyのキャリッジ紛争の影響もあり、2023年第4四半期には24万8,000人のビデオ顧客を失った（Dade Hayes/Deadline）
item.description:
Dade Hayes / Deadline:
Charter lost 248K video customers in Q4 2023, partly due to the Disney carriage dispute in September, after losing 145K video customers in Q4 2022  —  UPDATED with closing price.  Shares in Charter Communications dropped 16.5% Friday after the company reported disappointing fourth-quarter earnings …

item.title: スポティファイとジョー・ローガンが新たな複数年契約を締結、推定2億5,000万ドル相当、ローガンの番組はポッドキャスト・プラットフォームとYouTubeのビデオで視聴可能に（Anne Steele/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Anne Steele / Wall Street Journal:
Spotify and Joe Rogan sign a new multiyear deal, estimated to be worth $250M; Rogan's show will be available across podcast platforms and as videos on YouTube  —  Hit show to be distributed broadly, including on YouTube, rather than exclusively on audio-streaming service

item.title: 地域ニュースレター会社6AM CityがTegna主導で1000万ドルのシリーズAを調達、Tegna放送局のニュースや天気予報が一部市場の6AMニュースレターに含まれる（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Local newsletter company 6AM City raised a $10M Series A led by Tegna; news and weather from Tegna stations will be included in 6AM newsletters in some markets  —  Local newsletter company 6AM City has raised more than $10 million in series A funding round led by local broadcaster Tegna, Axios has learned.

item.title: メルク・マーキュリアディスがヒプグノシス・ソング・マネジメントのCEOを退任し、後任には現社長兼COOのベン・カトフスキーが就任する（Marc Schneider/Billboard）
item.description:
Marc Schneider / Billboard:
Merck Mercuriadis is stepping down as CEO of Hipgnosis Song Management and will be replaced by Ben Katovsky, the company's current president and COO  —  Mercuriadis will transition to chairman, with Ben Katovsky rising to chief executive as the advisor eyes smoother relations with its publicly listed royalty fund.
